qas.question: Where did the demonstrators meet in June of 1987?
Where did further protests take place?

context: On June 14, 1987, about 5,000 people gathered again at <a0_0>Freedom Monument<a0_0/> in <a1_0>Riga<a1_0/>, and <a2_0>laid flowers<a2_0/> to commemorate the anniversary of Stalin's mass deportation of <a3_0>Latvians<a3_0/> in 1941. This was the first large demonstration in the Baltic republics to commemorate the anniversary of an event contrary to official Soviet history. The authorities did not crack down on demonstrators, which encouraged more and larger demonstrations throughout the <a4_0>Baltic States<a4_0/>. The next major anniversary after the August 23 Molotov Pact demonstration was on November 18, the date of Latvia’s independence in 1918. On November 18, 1987, hundreds of police and civilian militiamen cordoned off the central square to prevent any demonstration at Freedom Monument, but thousands lined the streets of Riga in silent protest regardless.
